repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Problem: `extmark_splice()` was being called before `ml_replace()`, which caused the on_bytes callback to be invoked with the old buffer text instead of the new text.

Solution: store metadata for each match in a kvec, call `ml_replace()` once to update the buffer, then call `extmark_splice()` once per match.

Closes https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/36370.

<!--
  Thank you for contributing to Neovim!
  If this is your first time, check out https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-requests-prs
  for our PR guidelines.
-->

comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -3771,6 +3772,25 @@ static int do_sub(exarg_T *eap, const proftime_T timeout, const int cmdpreview_n
       bool skip_match = false;
       linenr_T sub_firstlnum;           // nr of first sub line
 
+      // Track where substitutions started (set once per line).
+      linenr_T lnum_start = 0;
+
+      // Track extmark_splice data for each match in the line.
+      typedef struct {
+        int start_col;         // Position in new text where replacement goes
+        lpos_T start;          // Match start position in original text
+        lpos_T end;            // Match end position in original text
+        int matchcols;         // Columns deleted from original text
+        bcount_t matchbytes;   // Bytes deleted from original text
+        int subcols;           // Columns in replacement text
+        bcount_t subbytes;     // Bytes in replacement text
+        linenr_T lnum_before;  // Line number before this substitution
+        linenr_T lnum_after;   // Line number after this substitution
+      } MatchExtmarkData;
+
+      garray_T match_extmarks = GA_EMPTY_INIT_VALUE;

@@ -3771,6 +3772,25 @@ static int do_sub(exarg_T *eap, const proftime_T timeout, const int cmdpreview_n
       bool skip_match = false;
       linenr_T sub_firstlnum;           // nr of first sub line
 
+      // Track where substitutions started (set once per line).
+      linenr_T lnum_start = 0;
+
+      // Track extmark_splice data for each match in the line.
+      typedef struct {
+        int start_col;         // Position in new text where replacement goes
+        lpos_T start;          // Match start position in original text
+        lpos_T end;            // Match end position in original text
+        int matchcols;         // Columns deleted from original text
+        bcount_t matchbytes;   // Bytes deleted from original text
+        int subcols;           // Columns in replacement text
+        bcount_t subbytes;     // Bytes in replacement text
+        linenr_T lnum_before;  // Line number before this substitution
+        linenr_T lnum_after;   // Line number after this substitution
+      } MatchExtmarkData;
+
+      garray_T match_extmarks = GA_EMPTY_INIT_VALUE;

@@ -3771,6 +3771,24 @@ static int do_sub(exarg_T *eap, const proftime_T timeout, const int cmdpreview_n
       bool skip_match = false;
       linenr_T sub_firstlnum;           // nr of first sub line
 
+      // Track where substitutions started (set once per line).
+      linenr_T lnum_start = 0;
+
+      // Track extmark_splice data for each match in the line.
+      typedef struct {
+        int start_col;         // Position in new text where replacement goes
+        lpos_T start;          // Match start position in original text
+        lpos_T end;            // Match end position in original text
+        int matchcols;         // Columns deleted from original text
+        bcount_t matchbytes;   // Bytes deleted from original text
+        int subcols;           // Columns in replacement text
+        bcount_t subbytes;     // Bytes in replacement text
+        linenr_T lnum_before;  // Line number before this substitution
+        linenr_T lnum_after;   // Line number after this substitution
+      } MatchExtmarkData;

@@ -3771,6 +3771,24 @@ static int do_sub(exarg_T *eap, const proftime_T timeout, const int cmdpreview_n
       bool skip_match = false;
       linenr_T sub_firstlnum;           // nr of first sub line
 
+      // Track where substitutions started (set once per line).
+      linenr_T lnum_start = 0;
+
+      // Track extmark_splice data for each match in the line.

comment_data.body:
The word "during" is raising questions for me. Is this PR intended to fix buffer updates emitted *after a substitution is confirmed*? Or *during an 'inccommand' preview*?

We should not send *any* buffer updates *during* a substitution (like during an 'inccommand' preview). The 'inccommand' preview is intentionally NOT an "edit" semantically or technically, and should not emit buffer updates. If it is emitting buffer updates before the user "confirms" the substitution, then that should be fixed (it should NOT emit updates).
Doesn't the preview happen before the substitution, not during it?

Preview is performed by calling `do_sub` (which this PR modifies) and then undoing it later (after the user "confirms" the substitute).

It looks like `extmark_splice` (buffer updates) is already called during 'inccommand' preview. I suppose this could be useful for API clients like vscode-neovim which need to "sync" buffers, but I don't think it makes sense to support...

I guess it's orthogonal to the change in this PR.

Oh I just noticed this in `:help api-buffer-updates` so I guess it's intentional:

```
    When {changedtick} is |v:null| this means the screen lines (display)
    changed but not the buffer contents. {linedata} contains the changed
    screen lines. This happens when 'inccommand' shows a buffer preview.
```

comment_regular_data.body:
~~The tests should explicitly disable 'inccommand', to make it clear that these tests are not testing anything emitting *during* 'inccommand' preview.~~

~~And also should add a small test that confirms that buffer updates are *not emitted* during 'inccommand' preview.~~

Edit: see https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/36487#discussion_r2534874323

title: fix(api): `substitute` calls `on_bytes` after modifying buffer
